roleset.name: move upward, quantifiably or metaphorically, (cause of) upward movement/increase
roleset.note: RAISE-V NOTES: Let's use EXT for numericals only, otherwise Arg2-MNR: (from raise.01-v)
RAISING-N NOTES: Based on Bolt data. Comparison to raise.01-n. See VN classes direction-9.4 and crane-40.3.2. Framed by Katie. (from raising.02-n)
RAISE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00080. Comparison to raise.01-v, verb-advance.02. See VN classes crane-40.3.2 and put_direction-9.4. Framed by Katie. (from raise.01-n)

roles.note:
Like raise.01-n, this differs from raise.01-v in that it has an extra beneficiary arguement. (from raising.02-n)
This frame differs from 'raise-v.01' in that it has arg2 as a recipient/beneficiary. All other args moved up by 1. (from raise.01-n)

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: The securities will raise about $10 billion in cash.

example.name: with extent and end point
example.text: Oil production will be raised by 11k barrels/day to about 321k barrels.

example.name: with manner
example.text: Companies raise their payouts most robustly only after profits are high.

example.name: locative
example.text: The president raised a number of issues in his 20-minute speech.

example.name: non-financial transitive
example.text: Mr. Coleman raised questions about Mr. Courter's credibility. Arg0 rel Arg1

example.name: args 2
example.text: CNN recently gave most employees raises of as much as 15 %

example.name: args 1, 2, and 5
example.text: their 15.5% pay raise over three years

role.descr: recipient of money (if different from arg0)

example.name: all args
example.text: The bankers also insist that the loans depend on the consortium raising more money from new and existing backers.

example.name: With benefactives
example.text: The raising of money for charity

example.name: all args
example.text: The boy scouts raised $2000 from downtown shop owners for the Red Cross.

roleset.name: rear or nurture
roleset.note: RAISING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to raise.03. No Vn or Fn classes. Framed by Katie. (from raising.01-n)

example.text: They have successfully rasied them on Gambian soil.

roleset.name: raise funds
roleset.note: FUNDRAISE-V NOTES: Ordinarily this would be "so-and-so raised funds for X" with "funds" in thearg1 position, but "funds" has been glommed onto the verbs itself andso cannot exist as an independent arg. For consistency, though, thebeneficiary is left in arg2. (from fundraise.01-v)
FUNDRAISING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, fundraise-v.01. No corresponding VNcls. (from fundraising.01-n)

example.name: polysythesis?
example.text: That impressed Robert B. Pamplin, Georgia-Pacific's chief executive at the time, whom [Mr. Hahn]-1 had met while *trace*-1 fundraising for the institute.

example.name: arg2
example.text: I work in educational fundraising and I would be so pi$$ed if I worked at a catholic institution and they tried to pull this BS .

example.name: arg 1
example.text: ICDD-sas complete a successful fundraising of 800 K?.
